thread.title: Cardinals vs Bombers to decide No. 3 spot
thread.title_full: Cardinals vs Bombers to decide No. 3 spot | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Christian Jacinto
title: Cardinals vs Bombers to decide No. 3 spot
text:
by Christian Jacinto
October 16, 2015 Games Today
(Mall of Asia Arena)
2 p.m. – Arellano vs CSB-LSGH (Jrs)
4 p.m. – Mapua vs JRU (Srs)
The guessing game that started a month ago ends today.
After five-time defending champion San Beda College and bitter rival Letran have settled the issue on who will own the top seeding in the NCAA Final Four, it will be the turn of Mapua and Jose Rizal University to take the spotlight when they dispute the No. 3 seeding at the Mall of Asia Arena.
But no matter who emerges the winner in their 4 p.m. showdown, both Mapua and JRU will remain at a disadvantage in the next round as they need to beat the top two seeds two in a row to advance to the Finals which is going to be a best-of-three affair.
The pressure will be much heavier for the loser since it will have the unenviable task of facing top-ranked San Beda on Tuesday while the winner takes on No. 2 Letran.
San Beda is out to become the first team in league history to win six straight championships.
Facing Letran is not easy either since the Knights are itching to end a decade of frustration.
So expect another interesting match between the two teams who are handled by former PBA MVPs – Atoy Co for Mapua and Vergel Meneses for JRU.
Of the two, Mapua is the hottest team, having won nine of its last 10 games, including an impressive 93-75 victory over last year’s runner-up Arellano University in a knockout for the final semis spot.
Credit Mapua’s renaissance to Josan Nimes and Allwell Oraeme.
“I think we started to peak at the right time,” said Nimes after posting 21 points in their victory over the Chiefs.
“We’re working really hard in practices and it’s nice to be put in this situation,” he added.
The Heavy Bombers, on the other hand, won their last six games to finish third behind the Lions and the Knights who wound up with similar 13-5 marks.
Meantime, Arellano and CSB-La Salle Greenhills will be clashing at 2 p.m. in the second phase of the step-ladder semifinals in the juniors division.
